children.value: Cloudflare URL normalization is similar to
, and modifies separators, encoded elements, and literal bytes in incoming URLs as follows:
These reserved characters are not encoded or decoded:
Other characters, for example literal byte values, are percent encoded.
Percent encoded representations are converted to upper case.
URL paths are normalized according to the
protocol. Deviations from this protocol include modifications to the following separators:
Consider a Firewall Rule that blocks requests whose URLs match
. The rule would not block a request containing an encoded element
. Normalizing incoming URLs at the edge helps simplify Cloudflare Firewall Rules expressions that use URLs.
